content.raw: Can we avoid the `gravityEntity` by adding the gravity component directly to the `worldEntity`?
content.html: Can we avoid the gravityEntity by adding the gravity component directly to the worldEntity?

content.raw: Understood. I was thinking that each Imu sensor object should track if it was initialized or not \(and avoid to store it in components\). But I saw that you deleted the initialized state directly, so it is ok.
content.html: Understood. I was thinking that each Imu sensor object should track if it was initialized or not (and avoid to store it in components). But I saw that you deleted the initialized state directly, so it is ok.

content.raw: @JChoclin , check out the changes to the altimeter on pull request #149, I think it's just a matter of using `EachNew`.
content.html: @JChoclin , check out the changes to the altimeter on pull request #149, I think it's just a matter of using EachNew.

content.raw:
> i like the idea of having each Imu as a separated “sensor“. That should fix this issue.

Yup, agreed that we should have one `ImuSensor` per sensor. But that's what we're already doing, right? Not sure how that addresses the issue.

> If not each Imu should have its own state. That could go into ImuPrivate and each Imu could have its own initialization function.

Yes, each sensor should have its own state, but that should be stored in components - again, as it's already being done. And sure, each sensor will need to initialize its transport system for example, and that's already done.

---

Just to be clear, all I meant here is that we shouldn't call `CreateEntities` only once - we should call it whenever there are new entities. I think the code in `ImuSensor` doesn't need to change.
content.html:
i like the idea of having each Imu as a separated “sensor“. That should fix this issue.

Yup, agreed that we should have one ImuSensor per sensor. But that's what we're already doing, right? Not sure how that addresses the issue.

If not each Imu should have its own state. That could go into ImuPrivate and each Imu could have its own initialization function.

Yes, each sensor should have its own state, but that should be stored in components - again, as it's already being done. And sure, each sensor will need to initialize its transport system for example, and that's already done.

Just to be clear, all I meant here is that we shouldn't call CreateEntities only once - we should call it whenever there are new entities. I think the code in ImuSensor doesn't need to change.

content.raw: i like the idea of having each Imu as a separated “sensor“. That should fix this issue.  If not each Imu should have its own state. That could go into ImuPrivate and each Imu could have its own initialization function. `CreateImuEntities` should call this functions for each Imu. I think I have a proposal, I will added it here.
content.html: i like the idea of having each Imu as a separated “sensor“. That should fix this issue. If not each Imu should have its own state. That could go into ImuPrivate and each Imu could have its own initialization function. CreateImuEntities should call this functions for each Imu. I think I have a proposal, I will added it here.

content.raw:
Sorry, I didn’t know about the Clang script. I will use it for this and my previous PRs.  
  
I will look into the test failures.
content.html:
Sorry, I didn’t know about the Clang script. I will use it for this and my previous PRs.

I will look into the test failures.

content.raw: Understood. I will do that.
content.html: Understood. I will do that.

content.raw: Thank you for your review! I am pushing the changes this afternoon. I agree to move Gravity into a component of world entity.
content.html: Thank you for your review! I am pushing the changes this afternoon. I agree to move Gravity into a component of world entity.

content.raw: Did some small tweaks on 2a09ca5
content.html: Did some small tweaks on 2a09ca5

update.description:
Smaller PR from [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/144/a-5-add-magnetometer-and-imu-sensors/diff).  
Includes imu sensor with its test.

There is still a difference between the physics gravity and the world gravity. I think that makes the imu test to have a really big tolerance. I think we can fix getting from physics the gravity value or setting the gravity with the value from SDF before merge. Worse case scenario I include the into the test sdf the same value used in physics.

This follows [Ian’s altimeter approach](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/?state=MERGED) and it is strongly based on that PR. I think we should move later this sensors into ign-sensors but we decided that can be discussed after Acropolis release.
update.title: [A-5] Add imu sensor

content.raw: Mind adding an example world to `examples/worlds` with quick instructions on the top like `altimeter.sdf`? We're trying to do this for every new feature so they're more easily discoverable and can be quickly tested manually. Thanks! :grin:
content.html: Mind adding an example world to examples/worlds with quick instructions on the top like altimeter.sdf? We're trying to do this for every new feature so they're more easily discoverable and can be quickly tested manually. Thanks!

content.raw: This comment seems out of place
content.html: This comment seems out of place

content.raw: This ties to my other comments about the gravity component, but just for completeness, I should mention that we should be able to remove this variable here. In general, we should try not to store state inside systems as much as possible, and keep it in a component, which all systems should be able to access.
content.html: This ties to my other comments about the gravity component, but just for completeness, I should mention that we should be able to remove this variable here. In general, we should try not to store state inside systems as much as possible, and keep it in a component, which all systems should be able to access.

content.raw: Another thing to note is that we're trying to keep `clang-tiny` happy, so be sure to run `./tools/clang_tidy.sh`
content.html: Another thing to note is that we're trying to keep clang-tiny happy, so be sure to run ./tools/clang_tidy.sh

content.raw: We could move the bulk of this logic to `Util.hh` to be reused across sensors.
content.html: We could move the bulk of this logic to Util.hh to be reused across sensors.

content.raw: This comment needs to be updated
content.html: This comment needs to be updated

content.raw: Part of the solution to fix `initialized` should involve using `EachNew` here instead of `Each`
content.html: Part of the solution to fix initialized should involve using EachNew here instead of Each

content.raw: We need to rethink this initialized logic now that we're about to support entities spawned at runtime. I just realized the altimeter has the same problem, so I'll fix that on pull request #143.
content.html: We need to rethink this initialized logic now that we're about to support entities spawned at runtime. I just realized the altimeter has the same problem, so I'll fix that on pull request #143.

content.raw: Do we need to store gravity inside the sensor? Couldn't we get it directly from the world instead? This way there is a single source of truth.
content.html: Do we need to store gravity inside the sensor? Couldn't we get it directly from the world instead? This way there is a single source of truth.

content.raw: Do we need an entity to store gravity? Couldn't we add `components::Gravity` directly to the world?
content.html: Do we need an entity to store gravity? Couldn't we add components::Gravity directly to the world?

content.raw: Just making sure you saw there are test failures on pipelines.
content.html: Just making sure you saw there are test failures on pipelines.
